TopicTitle: mechanical arm moving Parts to help to build a crane/Arm

Articles.Content:
I am trying to build a mechanical arm to retrofit onto a moving platform on mun, as I have discovered that the location I have landed is not flat,

I have tried to use the Romfarer_RoboticArmsPack_v29, but I discovered that it didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have the liftijng power to lift the mun module of the ground.

What I would like to do is build my own, and fix some moving parts, like ball joints, and arms so that I can create the arm, so that I am able to move and twist my modules into place

Is there any MODS out there that will do this, I did see a moving part on a YouTube Ã¢â‚¬Å“ConstellationÃ¢â‚¬Â were I go the idea from.

what your thinking of is damned robotics and infernal robotics

Edit: and also nothke_Dromoman

Edited August 3, 2013 by Helix935

Hi Helix

I tried the listed mods, but I am having issues getting them to work. I tried the Damned robotics and none of the mods was listed in my KSP 20.1version.

the Infernal Robotics I all ready tried and discovered that it is for space only, and the Dromoman mod just crash's. frustrating as hell

There is a bit of a problem with damned robotics at the moment.

You need infernal to get it to run, at least the plugin. You also need to go and make sure all the parts have PART { at the top of the file, and } at the bottom.
I think I will wait, as I don't free comfortable modifying the plugin / mod files

This crane was made using the docking port disk from Infernal Robotics. I had no issues installing this for .21. I am not sure exactly how much force these disk can provide but the rover hanging off the boom is 5 tons.

the problem I have is that the Module I would like to move has no command module which would allow me lower or raise the legs, this is why I was thinking about having a moving arm with a Docking port at the end that would allow me to lower and then connect to the module and then lift the module up in a controlled way so that I can move it and lower it back down in to the right place.

There aren't any ingame parts as I assume you've been told, however, I'd use damned robotics and KAS. I saw this guy did it in this full constellation program. It was probably the best way to do it as far as I have known

Edit: Ninja'd before I even read it!

Edited August 5, 2013 by Rhyunix

Unfortunately the DR plugin doesn't work with 0.21, however you can use the forked and updated Magic Smoke Industries Parts & Infernal Robotics plugin with the DR parts

There are instructions for updating the DR parts in the opening post of the MSI/IR thread also

@Rhynix. This is were I saw the mod, and liked the idea of having the moving parts.

@NoMrBond. when I install the mod, I don't get the Forked option, which Ithrough would be a good idea, so that I would be able to lift the whole module.

back to the drawing Board for me

@Rhynix. This is were I saw the mod, and liked the idea of having the moving parts.

@NoMrBond. when I install the mod, I don't get the Forked option, which Ithrough would be a good idea, so that I would be able to lift the whole module.

back to the drawing Board for me

Infernal Robotics is a fork (with permission) of the Damned Robotics plugin, which Sirkut has updated to work with 0.21.

You can use the MSI/IR plugin to make the DR parts work.

Install the DR parts (but delete the DR plugin), wrap the DR parts with PART{}, install MSI/IR and the DR parts should also work with the latest version of the game

Ok NoMrBond. I will have a look at this. andn report back

Thanks for all you help, I have follow your steps, and I have created a ZIP file, which I have tested on 0.21.1

I have removed the Craft Part, but if you want a copy then place drop me a email and I will be help to send you a copy
